availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Bingham (Caldwell Co. Ky, millwright and carpenter)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, millwright and carpenter. Ohio native. Married to Caroline America Freeman Bingham. Father of Tabitha Bingham. Married to Sarah Addeen Freeman Bingham in Eddyville, Kentucky, in February 1858. Father of Fillmore Bingham, Lucy Bingham, and Maddie Bingham. Millwright in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed Jabez Bingham as a millwright in Trigg County in 1850. Employed Robert H. Coy as a miller in Trigg County in 1850. Carpenter in Princeton in 1860. Employed Henry Howe as an apprentice in Princeton in 1860. Employed J. Morris and J. Swatzel as journeyman carpenters in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 299A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 115.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Bucksnort, p. 409B-410A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lyon County Marriages, Film #000321364, p. 323.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #28936.
"John Bingham (1825-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #160841512, accessed July 8, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/160841512.
